Name: Four Jars Inscribed for Yuya
Description: These four painted limestone jars are attached to a single base of painted wood and are hollow to a depth of four centimeters. The lids are decorated with rosettes in raised relief. They are painted in circles of yellow, green, red, and blue with yellow lines on a white background encircling all. The four jars are imitations of vessels used for ointment. The jars have text in two columns of cursive hieroglyphs addressed to Yuya, father of Queen Tiye.
